column4: I downloaded a package from the synaptic called "Desktop Search" which adds a little magnifying glass to my panel that allows search. Am I under the right impression that it does not search the entire file system, but only the home directory?
What's the best way to search for a file throughout the entire file system -- through the GUI not terminal ?
places, search for a file?
cool didn't know that was there, thanks
np
exaile is an MP3 player similar to iTunes but less bloated and cooler. :) It is the gnome equivelant of Amarok
oh , do you recommend it?
i'm using it right now, so far it is the best i've found for Ubuntu. I think I got mine from www.getdeb.net
great, isnt it available through synaptic?
it is but an earlier version... www.getdeb.net I believe has a later version. Synaptic programs are updated once every 6 months, at the same time as the new Ubuntu versions are released.
ah, and isnt there a command to check for updates for already installed programs ors omething?
no idea
0.2.8? I'm using 0.2.9.. No idea about synaptic, I got mine from www.getdeb.net
yea i found .9 on getdeb
Getdeb.net is nice because it allows newbies like myself to easily install programs, just double-click and it installs.
oh , nice, i thought id be complicated

any file that has the ".DEB" at the end is already packaged. So you double-click and it'll download any needed dependencies. :) I wouldn't make you download some version you had to compile. ;) I can't even do that myself.
great,
25, but ask in #ubuntu-offtopic for that kind of thing :)
personally i'd get rid of amarok first (i'm a freak like that) but it won't affect performance
i see, i would remove it anyway, dont want unwanted apps
